text: Hello, I'm here so I can provide you all with the title of Best VGM 1177 so you may find it, to complete the chronology of best vgms, which would be a shame if we missed even a single great song that was selected by this great person with a musician's ear. So without further wait: Best VGM 1177 - Final Fantasy XIV - Goobbue Mount, more specific: search Coeurl, Ahriman and Co. Mount (since it isn't special apparently). If you ever need to find another song that's lost, go to twitter and search for the one that is missing, you should be able to find something that leads you to it, goodbye everyone and please don't take this comment down because it's for history porpuses. How would I be able to listen to all these great themes knowing I've missed one?.
author: Hado Dado

text: Thanks pal, you're doing god's work here
author: The13th Rose

text: This game was really the true awakening of the Paper Mario franchise in my opinion. I'm so glad that Nintendo decided to follow in its footsteps and deliver multiple brilliant RPG-esque sequels rather than try to turn it into some kind of platforme- oh, wait...

text: Another summer another run at trying to complete this game. My Gamecube is at my folks home and I don't see them much. text: TTYD did basically everything better than the original PM, but I like the original better, simply because of the childish tone. TTYD had this too, but it was more simple goofiness than childishness. If that make any sense.

text: I recently played the one for the Wii, and it was a let down. Not only did it not have the turn-based action that I love, but nothing special about it, and the 3D effect was more tedious and annoying than anything. As long as this one is better or on par with the N64 version, I need to get it.

text: This game was so much fun, easily my favorite Mario RPG with the one on the SNES. Each chapter﻿ had its memorable moments and I loved the atmosphere inside the Glitz Pit. This game had surprisingly good ambient sound effects. Can't wait for Paper Mario 3DS, I'll replay the first Paper Mario right before it releases.
